title: M2-World-ERP
description: Business processes are now modeled on a per company basis. Information about manufactured product is lost this way.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal suggests the idea to build a business management suite to allow projects that would provide software for project management tools, accounting, e-commerce and so on the blockchain. While this sounds like an integration that could enhance value and onbaord other existing tools onto the network, the proposer does not indicate more than just the idea so at the moment the proposal does not address the challenge effectivley enough to support the idea based on the information provided. It would - however - be an interesting challenge for a future fund.
f6_assessments.q1: No. The proposer indicates clearly, that he or she would not be able to implement the project based on qualification/Skillset but would be willing to start working on teambuilding and collaboration. Information about prior experience and prior committment is not provided and cannot be taken into account. Budget of 100.000 Dollars in ADA is not broken down and can only be considered as an estimate. Again, this might make for a valuable challenge but at the moment with the information and qualification that is provided in the proposal, implementation is highly unlikely.
f6_assessments.q2: The project has no roadmap, team or milestones, measures of success or ways to include tokens/smart contracts or number of expected integrations is not included as part of the proposal so auditability is not possible. The proposer should take some time to provide more relevant information in future challenges, use the existing discord channel to start connecting to interested community members, research on how other integrations tackle this topic (like odoo which he or she mentions but does not provide further information) and give some additional statements on success criteria.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal lacks specifics and is attempting to tackle an enormous software solution by creating an Enterprise Resource management (ERP) system on the blockchain. Many large corporations, like SAP and Oracle, currently provide the bulk of these solutions.
f6_assessments.q1: This type of proposal would take a large team of developers, and there is little clarity in this proposal on who would implement the project.
f6_assessments.q2: There is no roadmap or milestones - impossible to audit the success or failure of this proposal.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal is lacking in specifics i.e. what kind of timeline and roadmap can we expect this ERP system to be build - ERP systems like SAP are massive codebase with dozens of teams working separate components of the ERP system.

It isn't completely clear from the information given how this ERP system will interoperate from company to company - I suggest providing more information so the voters can determine for themselves how feasible this ambitious project really is.

That being said an ERP system build on top of Cardano does indeed serve a vital purpose to manufacturing and I encourage you to submit a more complete proposal for next funding round.
f6_assessments.q1:
Given the proposal as-is, it is not very likely that will neither be implemented or succeed.

This is based both of the lack of timeline/roadmap, no KPIs and the incomplete team as they are still looking for developers committed to build it.
f6_assessments.q2:
No roadmap, timeline for the roadmap, or KPIs were included in the proposal, thus it is effectively impossible to quantitatively measure the success or failure of the proposal.

Proposers and voters alike should be aware that voting on a proposal with no clear KPIs or roadmap have no objective measure of success of said proposals that they are voting on, thus we are essentially flying in the dark.

solution: Build a business ERP like Odoo on the blockchain where everybody is part of the same database.
experience: Some software experience. Not enough for this size of project. Just a cool idea. Looking for collaborators.
